items.description:
The big news this week is MAUI Preview 7 has been released, and there are some good summary items in this weeks edition. For those of you holding off on starting with MAUI, now might be just the time to get going.

Here in Australia we are still in lockdown, which is a bit sad, but hopefully you have a good week ahead catching up with the latest Xamarin / MAUI news.

Till next week, stay safe.

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:

Till next week, stay safe.

❤

Kym

items.title: Long-running Operations on macOS and iOS with NSProcessInfo
items.description:
Using NSProcessInfo you can easily start and end long running processes through activities on iOS and macOS.

items.title: Adding Shadows with Xamarin Community Toolkit
items.description:
Shadows can help add a little depth to your UI's, but they are hard to implement cross platform. And that's where the Shadows feature of Xamarin Community Toolkit can help out.

Adding Shadows with Xamarin Community Toolkit by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Shadows can help add a little depth to your UI's, but they are hard to implement cross platform. And that's where the Shadows feature of Xamarin Community Toolkit can help out.

[**Adding Shadows with Xamarin Community Toolkit**](https://askxammy.com/adding-shadows-with-xamarin-community-toolkit/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://twitter.com/leomarisreyes11)

items.description:

items.title: Learning About Secure Storage Xamarin Essentials
items.description:
In Xamarin Essentials, Secure Storage allows you to save sensitive data, like a password. We'll look at the keychain and keystore of each specific platform.

Learning About Secure Storage Xamarin Essentials by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
In Xamarin Essentials, Secure Storage allows you to save sensitive data, like a password. We'll look at the keychain and keystore of each specific platform.

items.title: How to Reuse Xamarin.Forms Custom Renderers in .NET MAUI
items.description:
NET MAUI uses handler architecture whereas Xamarin.Forms uses renderer architecture. But don’t worry, .NET MAUI is still compatible with renderers. If you have a big project with complex custom renderers implemented and you have no idea to migrate them into handlers, then this blog post is for you.

How to Reuse Xamarin.Forms Custom Renderers in .NET MAUI by Selva Ganapathy Kathiresan
items.description_markdown:
NET MAUI uses handler architecture whereas Xamarin.Forms uses renderer architecture. But don’t worry, .NET MAUI is still compatible with renderers. If you have a big project with complex custom renderers implemented and you have no idea to migrate them into handlers, then this blog post is for you.

[**How to Reuse Xamarin.Forms Custom Renderers in .NET MAUI**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/how-to-reuse-xamarin-forms-custom-renderers-in-net-maui.aspx) by [Selva Ganapathy Kathiresan](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/selva-ganapathy-k)

embedded_links.title: **How to Reuse Xamarin.Forms Custom Renderers in .NET MAUI**

items.title: Dependency Injection with Microsoft.Extensions in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
With the Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection package setting up dependency injection becomes a breeze. Additionally, it might already be familiar to you from ASP.NET! Time to see how to add this package to a Xamarin.Forms project and make it work.

While this video uses Xamarin.Forms as a sample project, this should work the same for other .NET projects. In fact, ASP.NET and .NET MAUI already have some bits on board to make the implementation even easier!

Dependency Injection with Microsoft.Extensions in Xamarin.Forms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
With the Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection package setting up dependency injection becomes a breeze. Additionally, it might already be familiar to you from ASP.NET! Time to see how to add this package to a Xamarin.Forms project and make it work.

While this video uses Xamarin.Forms as a sample project, this should work the same for other .NET projects. In fact, ASP.NET and .NET MAUI already have some bits on board to make the implementation even easier!

[**Dependency Injection with Microsoft.Extensions in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abORCOhklUg) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

items.title: .NET MAUI Preview 7: VS2022 Templates and MAUI Blazor Apps
items.description:
We're getting close to the first release candidate for .NET MAUI, but first let's check out preview 7. Lots of new goodies: layouts, accessibility, but most importantly: templates in Visual Studio 2022! And one of the templates is a .NET MAUI Blazor App?! Let's learn what this is all about...

.NET MAUI Preview 7: VS2022 Templates and MAUI Blazor Apps by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
We're getting close to the first release candidate for .NET MAUI, but first let's check out preview 7. Lots of new goodies: layouts, accessibility, but most importantly: templates in Visual Studio 2022! And one of the templates is a .NET MAUI Blazor App?! Let's learn what this is all about...

[**.NET MAUI Preview 7: VS2022 Templates and MAUI Blazor Apps**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ZTQLI8BZGA) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **.NET MAUI Preview 7: VS2022 Templates and MAUI Blazor Apps**

items.title: What Happens to Xamarin Traditional With .NET 6 and .NET MAUI?
items.description:
With the introduction of .NET 6 and .NET MAUI, will there be a place for Xamarin Traditional aka Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android? Let's find out in this episode of Quick Questions...

What Happens to Xamarin Traditional With .NET 6 and .NET MAUI? by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
With the introduction of .NET 6 and .NET MAUI, will there be a place for Xamarin Traditional aka Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android? Let's find out in this episode of Quick Questions...

[**What Happens to Xamarin Traditional With .NET 6 and .NET MAUI?**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tr4vb9-OQ4I) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **What Happens to Xamarin Traditional With .NET 6 and .NET MAUI?**

items.title: .NET MAUI Preview 7
items.description:
It is a new month, which means it is time for a new .NET MAUI Preview! Preview 7 is here with some brand new optimizations for templates, accessibility, layouts, and performance! I walk through some of your most recent questions, full setup on my M1 Mac Book Air with the CLI and VS Code, and then head to my Windows machine and Visual Studio 2022 Preview 3 so tune in!

.NET MAUI Preview 7 - Full Windows & Mac Setup with CLI, VS Code, & Visual Studio 2022 by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
It is a new month, which means it is time for a new .NET MAUI Preview! Preview 7 is here with some brand new optimizations for templates, accessibility, layouts, and performance! I walk through some of your most recent questions, full setup on my M1 Mac Book Air with the CLI and VS Code, and then head to my Windows machine and Visual Studio 2022 Preview 3 so tune in!

[**.NET MAUI Preview 7 - Full Windows & Mac Setup with CLI, VS Code, & Visual Studio 2022**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eF5YcpyzQIo) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **.NET MAUI Preview 7 - Full Windows & Mac Setup with CLI, VS Code, & Visual Studio 2022**

items.title: Merge Conflict: 266: How not to architect a database
items.description:
James had an awesome feature request for his app, but it required storing thousands of rows of data. Instead of relying on decades old best practices he decided to roll his own serialization... was that the best? SQLite-net creator Frank lets him have it.

Merge Conflict: 266: How not to architect a database by Merge Conflict
items.description_markdown:
James had an awesome feature request for his app, but it required storing thousands of rows of data. Instead of relying on decades old best practices he decided to roll his own serialization... was that the best? SQLite-net creator Frank lets him have it. 

[**Merge Conflict: 266: How not to architect a database**](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/266) by [Merge Conflict](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/)

embedded_links.title: **Merge Conflict: 266: How not to architect a database**
